title: Here is a reading list of 20 articles up to 2021 that focus on gathering annotations using crowdsourcing and different approaches to crowdsourcing for efficient label collection

**"The Many Faces of Crowdsourcing: From the Wisdom of the Crowd to the Rise of Human Computation"** - This article provides an overview of the various applications of crowdsourcing, including annotation tasks
**"Crowdsourcing Systems on the World-Wide Web"** by Aniket Kittur et al
- A foundational paper discussing the design and implementation of crowdsourcing systems
**"How to Use Mechanical Turk for Cognitive Science Research"** by Michael Buhrmester et al
- This paper explores the use of Amazon Mechanical Turk for gathering data, including annotations
**"Crowdsourcing User Studies with Mechanical Turk"**
- Discusses methodologies for conducting user studies via crowdsourcing platforms
**"The Future of Crowd Work"** by Aniket Kittur et al
- Explores the potential and challenges of crowd work, including annotation tasks
**"Crowdsourcing for Usability Testing"** by Jeff Sauro
- Focuses on using crowdsourcing for usability testing, which often involves annotation
**"Crowdsourcing Ground Truth for Medical Relation Extraction"** by Dina Demner-Fushman et al
- Discusses the use of crowdsourcing for annotating medical data
**"Crowdsourcing for Difficult Data Annotation Tasks"** by Panagiotis G. Ipeirotis et al
- Explores strategies for using crowdsourcing to tackle challenging annotation tasks
**"Quality Management in Crowdsourcing Using Gold Judges Behavior"** by Omar Alonso et al
- Discusses methods for ensuring quality in crowdsourced annotations
**"Crowdsourcing for Subjective Labeling Tasks: A Case Study of Emotional Intelligence"** by Yla R
- Examines crowdsourcing for tasks that require subjective judgment
**"Active Learning with Amazon Mechanical Turk"** by Burr Settles
- Explores the integration of active learning with crowdsourcing to improve annotation efficiency
**"Crowdsourcing for Large-Scale Multimedia Annotation: The Role of Learning and Domain Expertise"** by Martha Larson et al
- Discusses the use of crowdsourcing for multimedia annotation
**"Crowdsourcing for Social Data Analysis: Tools, Methods, and Challenges"**
- Focuses on crowdsourcing for social data analysis, including annotation
**"Crowdsourcing for Language Resource Development: Challenges and Opportunities"** by Mark Liberman
- Discusses the use of crowdsourcing for developing language resources
- Explores the use of crowdsourcing for evaluating the relevance of information
**"Crowdsourcing for Speech Processing: Applications, Opportunities, and Challenges"** by Maxine Eskenazi
- Discusses the use of crowdsourcing for speech processing tasks, including annotation
**"Crowdsourcing for Image Annotation: Human vs. Machine"** by Luis von Ahn and Laura Dabbish
- A classic paper comparing human and machine performance in image annotation
**"Crowdsourcing for Data Collection: A Review of Applications and Methods"** by Yiling Chen et al
- Provides a comprehensive review of crowdsourcing applications and methods for data collection
**"Crowdsourcing for Data Annotation: A Survey"** by V
- Surveys various methods and applications of crowdsourcing for data annotation
**"Crowdsourcing for Data Labeling: A Scalable Approach to Building Machine Learning Datasets"** by Alex Sorokin and David Forsyth
- Discusses scalable methods for using crowdsourcing to build machine learning datasets
These articles cover a range of topics related to crowdsourcing for annotation, including methodologies, applications, challenges, and strategies for ensuring quality and efficiency
